TopicTitle: How many of your friends own KSP because of you?

Articles.Content: As the title said, how much have you spread KSP to people you know?
One, I think. Maybe two, maybe zero. I'll have to double check ^^;
3 at least.
At least 3 friends, my nephew, and my nephew's teacher; and I guess my nephew's teacher's students teacher's students also.
Just my brother. I convinced him to get it for me for Christmas, and he decided to get a copy for himself as well. Helped that Steam was doing a sale.
Unfortunately none. My sons dabble a little now and then, just to blow stuff up
Zero, nobody in my friends circle likes space flight. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
No one yet, but a friend got *me* into KSP though.
A couple.
Just one - most of the rest had Steam anyway, and knew about it before I did.

four people

Friends: only one bought the game.

Random strangers: a few dozen have claimed to.

I never got anyone to play the game, no matter how much I tried, unfortunately. And even the person who told me about the game no longer plays it. 

I felt lonely ever since. ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)
2. One friend and one acquaintance.

One friend, and another friend who started before me (and stopped) and sort-of plays again now because of me.

I'm currently trying to get my cousin to try it, but she said she doesn't want to play because it's too much of a sandbox game for her with no real endgame. I'm trying to persuade her again because of the new update, though.

My best friend is so close to getting KSP for himself. I once copied KSP onto his jump drive so he could play it, but knowing that was illegal and that Squad deserves better I made him delete it. He still likes KSP, I just need to get him to spend the money on Steam. :/

No one ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) Even my two nephews resisted my attempts at teaching them to play. Older prefers first-person shooters, younger sometimes turns the game on - but only to fool around with planes for couple of minutes. I feel so lonely ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)
two, one is my brother and one is a friend of mine.
zero. Told them all that this game is heading the same way as sins of a solar empire.
